attributes.action: Stop The Auction Of Sri Guru Gobind Singh's Armour
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Sotheby's Auction House has announced the upcoming auction of a "Rare Sikh Steel Armour Plate." 

Believed to belong to the 10th Guru of the Sikhs, Sri Guru Gobind Singh Ji, Sotheby's has described it as "A Rare Sikh Steel Armour Plate, North West India/Pakistan, 18th Century  - 10,000 – 12,000 GBP”

This is an invaluable piece of Sikh Heritage, There is only ONE other armour set known in existence.

We cannot allow assets of a culture to be sold at auction. The Armour of Sri Guru Gobind Singh Ji should be enshrined, appreciated and integrated into Sikh History. 

Auctioning of this armour must be stopped, it’s an insult to all religions and cultures, not just Sikhs!

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
